content.question: A circuit consists of a battery, a switch, a voltmeter, and two resistors, as shown. Another circuit element can be connected between terminals <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>. In Trial <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a resistor of resistance <math alttext="2 R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is placed between <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and the voltmeter measures a potential difference of <math alttext="delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> immediately after the switch is closed. In Trial <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, an inductor of inductance <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is placed between <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and the voltmeter measures a potential difference of <math alttext="delta V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> immediately after the switch is closed. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction delta V sub 1 over delta V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>?

topic.text: 13.5: Circuits with Resistors and Inductors (LR Circuits)

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
